data.title: Woody Allen In The Film Midnight In Paris - 609 Words
data.meta_description: Free Essay: While I was watching Midnight in Paris I enjoyed many aspects that Woody Allen implemented throughout the film. The two choices that Woody Allen...
data.text:
While I was watching Midnight in Paris I enjoyed many aspects that Woody Allen implemented throughout the film. The two choices that Woody Allen made that I think work are the music that was accompanied by the footage of Paris in different time periods and the actors that were chosen to portray the characters. I also enjoyed observing the main character Gil who is played by Owen Wilson, grow from an indecisive person into an assertive man. When the movie begins, the song “Let’s Do It” written by Cole Porter, is sung by Conal Fowkes, while footage of modern of Paris is playing. Right way the audience is greeted by old and new Paris. This allows the audience know that although Paris is modern the city holds its past with reverence. The music transport the audience into the 1920s while the movie is playing. Another song by Cole Porter, “You Got That Thing” is also sung by Conal Fowkes, is upbeat and playful. Then songs like …show more content…

Both, Owen Wilson and Rachel McAdams who plays Inez, convey the relationship between the characters in comedic yet serious way. Their conversations make the audience want to laugh out loud at Gil’s amusing comments or raise their eyebrow at Inez’s rude remarks. Then Woody Allen infuses these historical figures that shown throughout Gil’s adventures traveling back into the 1920s. I enjoyed the interactions between Scott Fitzgerald played by Tom Hiddleston and his wife Zelda played by Alison Pill, it fun hearing Scott say “old sport” in conversation. It is funny to see how macho and manly Ernest Hemingway played by Corey Stoll, must have acted during the 1920s: stealing women from their husbands and asking for a boxing match. Watching famous people from the 1920s come alive through these wonderful actors and actresses was very surreal and exciting.
